document.heading: 2025 Tribal Employment Rights Office Ordinance Act
document.text: At a duly called Session of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 9th day of August, 2025, the following Resolution and Law were adopted.

recital.text: the Legislature is vested with the authority to pass laws and resolutions pursuant to Article VI, Section 6(a) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe; and,

the Tribe passed a Tribal Employment Rights Ordinance ("TERO") in 1997, and the Tribe currently operates a TERO office and as a guide to the interpretation and application of this Ordinance, the public policy of the Kiowa Tribe; and,

TERO Ordinances require that all employers engaged in business on reservations give preference to qualified Indians in all aspects of employment, contracting, and all other business or economic development activities.

the Legislature has determined that it is in the best interests of the Tribe to pass the TERO Ordinance Act to reaffirm TERO and to bring it into compliance with the Constitution of the Tribe.

recital.conjunction: NOW THEREFORE IT BE IT RESOLVED;
recital.text: that the Legislature hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "2025 Tribal Employment Rights Office Ordinance Act".

text.b: C E R T I F I C A T I O N

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "2025 Tribal Employment Rights Office (TERO) Ordinance Act" ("TERO Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of the "2025 TERO Ordinance Act" is to re-establish a TERO office to implement the TERO Act to ensure Indian Preference in employment and contracting, and to establish fees for doing business within the jurisdiction of the Tribe.

para.text: . The Tribe passed a Tribal Employment Rights Ordinance ("TERO") in 1997, and the Tribe currently operates a TERO office; and,

. The Legislature has determined that it is in the best interests of the Tribe to pass the TERO Act. This action is intended to reaffirm the 2025 Tribal Employment Rights Office Ordinance (TERO) and to ensure that it is fully compliant with the Constitution of the Tribe.

. The Kiowa Tribe Legislature has an ongoing commitment to uphold the rights and opportunities for our Kiowa Tribal members and community, by aligning the TERO with our Kiowa Constitution. This will further strengthen our governance and support our future economic development goals.
. The Legislature hereby reaffirms the TERO law attached hereto.
. The outdated references to the prior "Business Committee" that appear in TERO shall be modified to say, "Chairman and Legislature".
. The TERO fee schedules that appear in Section 11 of the TERO Act may be modified by the Commission in accordance with the "2025 TERO Ordinance Act".
